org.jdesktop.jdic.filetypes
Class Action

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.jdic.filetypes.Action
public class Action
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a key/value mapping pair. The key could be a verb applied to a file by launching an associated application. It could also be an information key stores the value.

The action could be added to an Association, and then registered to the system registry(on Windows) or MIME database(on Gnome desktop)

Only Action objects with both verb field and command field filled can be added or removed from Association objects.

See Also:
Association

Constructor Detail

Action

public Action(java.lang.String verb,
              java.lang.String command)
Constructor of an Action object. Which may be used as part of an association to be registered/unregistered into/from the Gnome MIME database. 
 On Windows
   The verb field could be like: open, view, print, etc. Or any
   user defined verbs.
 On Gnome desktop
   *Only* open verb could be used, and actions with other verbs will be ignored.
   Since other user defined verbs couldn't be used in file viewers, such as Nautilus,
   to register those verbs in the MIME type database is meanless.

Parameters:
verb - a given verb value.
command - a given command value.

setDescription

public void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
Sets the description field.

Notice: This field is not required to create a valid Action object. It's used only on Windows, and not used on Gnome for both Linux and Solaris.

Parameters:
description - a given description value.
